title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 126.3 - Forms of applications
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 126.3 - Forms of applications

State Regulations

Sections
52, 103, 230, 249
and
250
of the Highway

Law authorize certain uses of State highway lands and State-owned bridges and
culverts, provided a permit is first obtained from the Commissioner of

Transportation. Also no tree or plant shall be planted, trimmed or removed
unless a permit shall first be obtained from the New York State Department of

Transportation. Applications for permits in relation to the provisions of such
sections must be prepared and submitted on forms furnished by the New York

State Department of Transportation. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
126.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
